titleStmt.title: [By the right honourable the House of] Commons. Die Lunae, 3. Januar. 1641. It is this day ordered upon the question, by the Commons House of Parliament; that if any persons whatsoever, shall come to the lodgings of any member of this House, and there doe offer to seale the trunks, doores, or papers of any members of this House, or to seize upon their persons; ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

titleStmt.title: [By the right honourable the House of] Commons. Die Lunae, 3. Januar. 1641. It is this day ordered upon the question, by the Commons House of Parliament; that if any persons whatsoever, shall come to the lodgings of any member of this House, and there doe offer to seale the trunks, doores, or papers of any members of this House, or to seize upon their persons; ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
The years are given according to Lady Day dating.
Includes: The declaration agreed upon by the committee of the House of Commons appointed to sit in the Guildhall in London, to consider the safety of the kingdome, and of the city of London.
Imperfect: item at C3:1[46] trimmed at head affecting title; item at C5:1[68] trimmed at head and foot affecting title and imprint. Title and imprint data taken from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
